episode.content: [BIZ STREAM SPECIAL EDITION] This series of special editions feature selected stories from BIZ STREAM's signature "On-Site" reports. Off the coast of Tohoku, hungry sea urchins are wiping out kelp forests. A young entrepreneur has come up with a way to stop them that could provide additional economic benefits to the region by collecting, feeding, and selling the prickly pests. In other parts of Japan, a major steel producer is using one of its byproducts, steel slag, to assist in the regrowth of marine plant life. This episode highlights the efforts of companies that are working to counter the effects of seafloor desertification along Japan's coastlines.
episode.description: This special edition of Biz Stream highlights the efforts of companies that are working to counter the effects of seafloor desertification and bring back marine plant life to Japan's coastal waters.
episode.subtitle: Saving the Seas with Sustainability
episode.title: BIZ STREAM

episode.content: [BIZ STREAM SPECIAL EDITION] This series of special editions feature selected stories from BIZ STREAM's signature "On-Site" reports. As the battle continues against COVID-19, advances in antimicrobial and disinfectant treatments are receiving more attention than ever. This episode highlights efforts to fight against microscopic threats by featuring a special antimicrobial coating that was inspired by ancient treatment techniques for protecting and preserving Japanese artifacts and artwork as well as the first safe-for-human UV light that effectively inactivates COVID-19.
episode.description: This special edition of Biz Stream features an antimicrobial coating inspired by ancient Japanese techniques for protecting artwork as well as a COVID-19 inactivating UV light that is safe for humans.
episode.subtitle: Japan's Germ-Fighting Tech
episode.title: BIZ STREAM
